newsitem.title: GREECE: Austrians hurt in Greek crash may be flown home.
newsitem.headline: Austrians hurt in Greek crash may be flown home.

text.p: Greek and Austrian authorities were hoping to fly home home five Austrian tourists on Thursday who were hurt in a head-on car crash on the Greek holiday island of Rhodes.

A 17-year-old Austrian girl, Sylvia Bergsmann, and her mother Kornelia were among the tourists killed on Wednesday when their minibus collided with a pick-up truck on their way back from a day-trip to the ancient site of Lindos, 55km from Rhodes town.

Another five tourists including Bergsmann's father and seven-year-old sister were seriously injured. They were transferred by a Hellenic Air Force C-130 airplane to Athens hospitals on Wednesday night.
The Austrian embassy in Athens said it was conferring with doctors on whether they could fly the injured to Austria.

Austrian ambassador Hans Sabaditsch said two of the tourists were in "not very good condition" but that seven-year-old Julia Bergsmann was in "pretty good shape for the circumstances". He gave no details on the condition of her father Alfred.
